justification: The Methods section states: "We assessed anhedonia using the SHAPS."
The questionnaire battery description notes "as well as the DARS" when listing the tools used to measure anhedonia.
It is explicitly written: "Apathy was assessed with the AES."
The article reports: "we screened participants for meeting diagnostic criteria for current, past, or recurrent MDD using the M.I.N.I."
The circadian measures section indicates: "Two questionnaires targeted circadian rhythm: the MEQ..."
The same sentence lists "...and the MCTQ" as the second instrument for chronotype.
Methods note: "Metabolic health was assessed by collecting self-reported height and weight, used to calculate BMI."
The text adds: "Additionally, the FINDRISC was used to calculate individual risk scores for metabolic disease."
The questionnaire list concludes: "Finally, the International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ) was included for exploratory investigations of physical activity."
